channel.title: Advice to the Players
channel.description: Phillip Kelly and Jonathan Redding of the Los Angeles Theatre Ensemble bring you Advice to the Players, a podcast about exploring theme, character, and acting choices in Shakespeare's plays.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Shakespeare analysis for actors, by actors.
channel.itunes:author: Jonathan Redding and Phillip Kelly
channel.itunes:summary: Phillip Kelly and Jonathan Redding of the Los Angeles Theatre Ensemble bring you Advice to the Players, a podcast about exploring theme, character, and acting choices in Shakespeare's plays.

item.title: Episode 21: The Wheel Has Come Full Circle
item.description: JR and PK conclude their discussion of King Lear with Alex Parker (Edmund) Gus Krieger (Edgar) and Leon Russom (Gloucester) of the Porters of Hellsgate. This episode includes adult language.

item.title: Episode 20: A Wheel of Fire
item.description: JR and PK talk with Thomas Bigley, Assoc. Artistic Director of the Porters of Hellsgate, and Larry Cedar (DEADWOOD; FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS) about their recent collaboration on the Porters' KING LEAR. This episode contains adult language.

item.title: Episode 19: The Fault, Dear Brutus
item.description: PK and JR talk with Malik El-Amin, Artistic Director of the Griot Theatre, and Cynthia Beckert about their recent collaboration on a production of Julius Caesar set against the backdrop of George R. R. Martin's Westeros.

item.title: Episode 18: It Will Have Blood, They Say
item.description: JR and PK chat with Rob Nagle, Co-Artistic Director of The Antaeus Company; and Jessica Kubzansky, Co-Artistic Director of The Theatre at Boston Court about their recent collaboration on Antaeus' production of Macbeth.

item.title: Episode 16: Bright Smoke
item.description: PK and JR talk with Jeremy Lelliot, Artistic Director of Coeurage Theatre Company about his Romeo and Juliet. True love vs. teenage angst, Peter Dinklage, Anonymous, and all things Mercutio are discussed.

item.title: Episode 15: Twelfth Night, Part 2
item.description: PK and JR talk to Robert Dean, Abby Craden, and Angela Gulner regarding their recent performances as the lover's trio of Orsino, Olivia, and Viola (respectively) in A Noise Within's production of Twelfth Night.

item.title: Episode 14: Twelfth Night, Part 1
item.description: PK and JR interview A Noise Within's Deborah Strang, Apollo Dukakis, and Jeremy Rabb regarding their recent performances as Maria, Sir Toby Belch, and Sir Andrew Aguecheek in Twelfth Night. Hilarity ensues.

item.description: PK and JR interview Charlie Pasternak, artistic director of the Porters of Hellsgate, about his experiences directing their production of Troilus and Cressida. WARNING: this episode contains explicit language.

item.description: JR and PK talk to Associate Artistic Director of the Shakespeare Center of Los Angeles Chris Anthony about the Center's trademark Will Power to Youth Program, and Shakespeare as a force for change.

item.title: Episode 7: Sad Stories of the Death of Kings
item.description: Phillip and Jonathan brainstorm a production of Richard II, with Phillip examining the role of Richard and Jonathan conceptualizing from a directorial standpoint. The duo discussed how Shakespeare laid the foundation for the history cycle to come, and unlikely parallels to Star Wars and Spider Man are made.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Redding and Phillip Kelly

item.title: Episode 6: Too Much Midsummer
item.description: Phillip and Jonathan interview Gedaly Guberek of Coeurage Theatre Company on his experiences with great comic roles, the street cred of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern, Shakespeare in LA, King Lear, Fleetwood Macbeth, and too many bad productions of Midsummer.

item.title: Episode 5: Nothing But Thunder
item.description: Phillip and Jonathan interview teacher, director, and Production Manager of the Ruskin Group Theatre, the multi-talented Mike Reilly. They discuss challenges and methods for bringing Shakespeare to young actors, the integration of Meisner with classical text, parallels between Shakespeare and Woody Allen, and perhaps the ultimate "problem play", Measure for Measure.

item.title: Episode 3: This Thing of Darkness I Acknowledge Mine
item.description: Phillip and Jonathan sit down to talk with Drew Shirley about his recent experiences directing and acting in Hamlet and The Tempest, and his upcoming production of King Lear. The woes of black box theatre and links between Lear and the Tempest, and between Caliban and Edgar, are examined.

item.title: Episode 1: The Ancient
item.description: Hosts Phillip Kelly and Jonathan Redding begin their actor-oriented exploration of Shakespeare's plays and characters with an examination of the critical and performance history of Shakespeare's greatest villain, Iago. The duo delve extensively into their own experience with a recent production of Othello.
